intro: Cheiridopsis staminodifera, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. The plant is well adapted to drought conditions, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves.
